title: Best iPhone 16 cases for 16 & Plus, 16 Pro & Pro Max
content:
Macworld

The first thing you should do after buying a new iPhone 16, be it an iPhone 16 Plus, Pro or Max, is to admire it and then swiftly cover it up. Buy yourself an iPhone 16 case to protect your precious mobile after splashing a ton of cash on it, and add some style to make your new handset more personal.

Cases come in more shapes and size and with more functionality than you’d believe. We have hand tested the best to find the perfect case for your iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max.

  • Best clear iPhone 16 cases
  • Best-looking iPhone 16 cases
  • Best protective cases for iPhone 16
  • Best leather and leather-alternative iPhone 16 cases
  • Best iPhone 16 cases with wallet
  • Best iPhone 16 case with built-in keyboard
  • Best iPhone 16 cases with lanyards
  • Best phone slings

iPhone 16 case: Protection

The most common causes for accidental smartphone damage are: dropping your phone on the ground, it falling from a pocket or bag, or it being knocked off a table. The main results of such phone accidents are cracked and scratched screens, followed by chipped corners and sides. In fact, research shows that within 10 weeks of purchase, half of all new phone users will drop their handset. D’oh!

Even a basic phone case will offer some protection against such everyday drops and knocks, and some are built to withstand more catastrophic accidents. A few years ago, such ultra-protective cases meant you’d be carrying around something the size and weight of a brick, but modern materials mean that protective cases can be relatively slim and light. Clever design and tough-but-thin materials such as Kevlar and Graphene are key to the levels of robustness—but it remains the case that the bulkier the case, the more protection it will offer as long as it is also clever and made of the right stuff.

Let’s face it the iPhone is basically made front and back of glass—even if it is a new version of Ceramic Shield that Apple claims is “two times tougher than any smartphone glass”—and glass dropped on the floor usually ends in despair.

Look for raised edges (known as a bezel) around the screen that will protect it from drop cracks and scratches. Another point of obvious weakness is the camera lens area, and you should go for a case with a raised edge around that part, too. Where we have the exact dimensions, we have included this information in our case reviews below.

Look for button covers—in metal or plastic. Some cases prefer cutouts but may offer less protection as a result.

The iPhone 16’s new Camera Control on the right side of all the iPhone 16 models may take third-party case makers time to catch up as most won’t have seen the latest iPhone before Apple announced it to the world. This “button” is capacitive so it can’t be covered using standard materials in the same way as the other iPhone buttons can. In its own cases, Apple (and Apple-owned Beats) utilizes a piece of sapphire crystal coupled with a conductive layer to communicate finger movements—including taps, slides and swipes—to the button below.

That means it retains all its functionality, including the half-press and swipes. At launch, only the OtterBox Lumen iPhone 16 cases, reviewed below, feature the same Camera Control covering. This case is the only third-party case on sale in the Apple Store so it’s likely that OtterBox was briefed earlier than other case makers. However, we’d expect some of the cases reviewed below to replace Camera Control cutouts with similar coverings in the weeks and months ahead as they play catch up. A similar thing happened with the new Action button on the iPhone 15, and third-party cases changed their cutouts for buttons quite quickly.

iPhone 16 case: Style

Apple makes the iPhone a thing of sleek beauty and offers a small range of colors (exciting for the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus, but rather dull for the Pro and Pro Max). If you want to keep this Apple elegance while still protecting the phone, choose a clear case that won’t detract from the Apple designers’ art. If you want to add more personality—if only to distinguish your iPhone from those of your family, friends or colleagues—there are hundreds of designs to choose from. Some are quite beautiful, some fine art, and some I wouldn’t want to be seen with in a dark room.

And iPhone 16 cases come in many forms: wallet cases, cases that support bike and car mounts, phone pouches, sleeves, slings and cases with belt-clips. Here we keep adding the best we can find as they come in for testing.

iPhone 16 case: Fit

Ensure you choose the right case for your exact model so that it fits correctly over the buttons and camera lenses for uninterrupted use. Where possible we have linked to the buying pages for each model: iPhone 16 (6.1 inch), iPhone 16 Plus (6.7 inch), iPhone 16 Pro (6.3 inch) and iPhone 16 Pro Max (6.9 inch).

Don’t think you can squeeze your new 16 model iPhone into a case for an older model. Sometimes a new iPhone is the same size as the previous model, but not the 16 unfortunately. Upgraders need a new case.

iPhone 16 case: magnetic wireless charging

Also make sure that the case is MagSafe compatible so that you can charge wirelessly with a MagSafe charger while your iPhone 16 stays in its case. So-called “clear” cases sadly require a huge white ring on their back to be compatible with MagSafe charging. Colored, patterned or leather cases hide their magnets better.

You can, of course, still charge via a USB-C cable—which will always be the fastest way to charge an iPhone—and an iPhone charger.

Best clear iPhone cases for iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max

If covering up Apple’s iPhone offends your inner Jony Ive, look for a clear, transparent case that keeps the iPhone’s looks as wonderful as they were straight out of the box.

1. Apple iPhone 16 Clear Case with MagSafe – Best clear iPhone 16 case

Pros

  • Made by Apple
  • Shows off iPhone’s color

Cons

  • Basic protection
  • Expensive
Price When Reviewed: $49
Best Prices Today: $39.99 at Amazon$39.99 at Best Buy$49 at Apple
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 29g
  • Camera edge: 2mm
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Covered
  • Colors: Clear

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

This simple, rigid iPhone 16 protective case from Apple is thin and light, and by design, it doesn’t disguise the color of your iPhone 16 that you chose when you purchased it. Why pick out a Pink or Desert Titanium iPhone 16 Pro Max, only to cover it up in a black plastic case or something with badly drawn flowers on it? With Apple’s Clear case, you get decent protection without ruining the look of the phone.

(If you want a black case or flowery pattern instead of Apple’s small palette of colors, we have plenty for you to choose from lower down this feature.

The Apple Clear Case is made from a blend of optically clear polycarbonate and other flexible materials, with a scratch-resistant coating on both the inside and outside. While it’s more protective than silicone cases and features a robust-looking 2mm camera lip, you can find tougher cases, which we have reviewed below. There is one part of the case that isn’t clear—the white MagSafe ring on the back.

As with all the Apple cases, the Camera Control is covered with a capacitive button that allows for finger taps and gestures without compromising on protection. The bottom of the case is a large cutout, however, leaving the USB-C port, speakers and microphone exposed.

At 29g it’s super light, and while the rigid case adds a little bulk, it’s worth a little compromise for that layer of protection. All materials and coatings are optimized to prevent yellowing over time.

There are also cheaper clear cases, which we have also tested for you. But the Apple badge is a sure sign of quality, as you’d expect.

The colors on the new iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max models aren’t as exciting as the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus, though, so we wouldn’t blame you for deciding on something more joyful.

2. ESR Zero Clear Case for iPhone 16 – Best budget clear iPhone 16 case

Pros

  • Shows off iPhone’s color
  • Flexible
  • Affordable

Cons

  • Basic protection
Price When Reviewed: $15.99
Best Prices Today: $7.99 at Amazon$15.99 at ESR
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 27g
  • Raised edge: 1mm
  • Camera edge: 0.7mm
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Clear

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

If you want basic protection for your new iPhone 16, the clear ESR Zero Clear Case has a 1.2mm front edge to protect the screen and a smaller-than-most 0.7mm camera guard. It’s made from a crystal-clear polymer, which ESR claims resists yellowing for longer than cheaper cases.

It is wireless compatible so you don’t need to flip the case off to charge wirelessly.

ESR also makes other less flexible but tougher clear cases, such as the iPhone 16 Air Armor Clear Case with better drop protection and AirGuard corners.

The iPhone 16 Pro Classic Hybrid Case has a tough scratch-resistant acrylic back and is available in a Shimmer effect that adds a little more excitement and personality to your average clear case.

The iPhone 16 Classic Hybrid Case with Stash Stand, which features military-grade protection and a handy built-in kickstand for stable viewing, is reviewed below.

These clear alternatives add a little more weight and cost but are recommended for their extra protection and features.

3. Totallee Super Thin Case for iPhone 16 – Slimmest, lightest hard clear iPhone 16 case

Pros

  • Slimmest clear case
  • Lightest case

Cons

  • Basic protection
  • MagSafe costs more
Price When Reviewed: From $35
Best Prices Today: $35 at Amazon$35 at Totallee
  • MagSafe compatible: Optional
  • Weight: 8g
  • Button covers: Covered
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Clear, Frosted Clear, Frosted Black, Frosted Red, Frosted Green, Frosted Navy Blue

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

This is the slimmest (0.5mm) iPhone 16 case we have tested and—by a long way—the lightest at just 8g. Totallee claims the case weighs 0.2oz, which is 3g but our scales weighed it at 8g, which could just be a failing of our scales. In either case, even 8g is barely noticeable.

Even at this weight, there are button covers, and a cutout for the Camera Control.

There is a clear version and a similar Frosted Clear model, plus a bunch of other frosted colors to choose from. Note that you have to pay a little more for the MagSafe-compatible versions, which no doubt add a little weight and thickness in parts.

4. ESR iPhone 16 Classic Hybrid Case with Stash Stand – Best clear iPhone 16 case with stand

Pros

  • Shows off iPhone’s true color
  • Built-in kickstand

Cons

  • Heavy
Price When Reviewed: $22.99
Best Prices Today: $19.99 at Amazon$22.99 at ESR
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 41g
  • Raised edge: 1.2mm
  • Camera edge: 0.7mm
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout

Colors: Clear, Clear/Black, Clear/Blue, Clear/Pink, Clear/Green, Clear/Gray

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

A more functional clear option is ESR’s Classic Hybrid Case with Stash Stand, available for all models of the iPhone 16 family. Make sure you choose your exact model.

It is transparent, aside from the required giant MagSafe icon, and more affordable than the Apple clear case. The kickstand—otherwise hidden in the camera ring—is an added bonus, working in both landscape and portrait modes.

The metal stand is an extra camera guard when not in use. ESR even suggests you can use it to carry your iPhone on your finger when your hands are full. If so, you’ll be interested in the protection it offers if it slides off your finger…

There’s the usual tough talk of military-grade protection, with the case featuring shock-absorbing AirGuard corners and a 0.7mm camera lip. At 40g, it’s one of the heavier clear cases, which is caused by the handy metal kickstand.

5. Casetify clear Impact and Bounce Cases for iPhone 16 – Most customizable clear iPhone 16 case

Pros

  • Shows off iPhone’s true color
  • Protection level options
  • Built-in kickstand option

Cons

  • Not entirely transparent
Price When Reviewed: From $72
Best Prices Today: $72 at Casetify

MagSafe compatible: Yes

Weight: 45g

Raised edge: 1.4mm

Camera edge: 2mm

Button covers: Plastic

Action button: Covered

Camera Control: Cutout

Colors: Clear

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

One of our favorite clear options is Casetify’s Impact and Bounce cases, which are both available for all models of the iPhone 16 family. Casetify offers these cases in a selection of protection levels and handily shows you what each case will look like depending on the color of your iPhone.

It is solidly built and feels robust, offering a minimum of 6.6ft (2m) drop protection up to 32.8ft (10m) if you choose the Ultra Bounce Case.

For a little extra outlay, the Impact Case can be ordered with an integrated stand, otherwise hidden in the camera ring.

The case edges aren’t clear because they feature extra-protective EcoShock or TesseLock designs. On one side there are sockets to easily attach phone charms.

Casetify

The Bounce Case boasts 21.3ft (6.5m) drop protection, while the Ultra Bounce promises an incredible 23.8ft (10m). The more protection, sadly the less of the original phone can be seen even in a clear case, but most of the shock absorption on the Bounce case family protrudes from the corners.

6. Rokform Crystal Case iPhone 16 – Most protective clear iPhone 16 case

Pros

  • Shows off iPhone’s color (mostly)
  • Robust protection

Cons

  • Not entirely transparent
  • Not MagSafe compatible
  • Heavy
Price When Reviewed: $69.99
Best Prices Today: $69.99 at Amazon£69.99 at Rokform
  • MagSafe compatible: No
  • Weight: 75g
  • Raised edge: 2mm
  • Camera edge: 1mm
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Clear with black trim

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

For those who want to see and show off their iPhone’s original coloring, but still gain maximum protection, Rokform offers its Crystal Case for the iPhone 16 family. This is more solid looking than even the Casetify Ultra Bounce reviewed above.

As you’d expect, that protection comes at the price of some bulk and heft. It’s not fully clear because its black sides, edges and corners are made from a military-grade polycarbonate and TPU combination to absorb shocks from drops and falls.

At present, the Rokform cases are too thick to work with all MagSafe chargers so you will likely need to remove your phone from the case to charge it wirelessly. The company is planning a thinner version, and we’d recommend waiting for that MagSafe-compatible version if you want accessible wireless charging.

The case also features the Rokform’s famous twist-lock and magnetic mounting system for bike, motorcycle and car mounts. If you’re going biking with iPhone on your handlebars, a super-protective case is a must.

Rokform does ship internationally, but you’ll need to check the fees depending on your region, and remember that customs charges also vary by country.

7. Incase Slim Case for MagSafe for iPhone 16

Pros

  • Shows off iPhone’s true color
  • Dedicated lanyard loop
Price When Reviewed: $39.99
Best Prices Today: $39.99 at Amazon$39.99 at Best Buy$39.99 at Incase
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Cutout
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Clear, Clear/Black, Clear/Deep Space Blue, Clear/Blush Pink, Clear/Highland Green

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

This hardshell iPhone 16 case is similar to the Apple Clear Case, although with a cutout for the Camera Control rather than leaving it covered.

While it looks almost invisible—except for the necessary white MagSafe area— this case, made from recycled polycarbonate and TPU, still offers 8-foot drop protection with corner air pockets.

The sides and buttons feature a frosted texture for enhanced grip. Also included is a handy dedicated lanyard loop.

The straight clear Incase Slim Case for MagSafe is joined by shaded models in four subtle color ways.

Best-looking iPhone cases for iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max

While some will prefer a clear case to keep their iPhone’s natural color, others are easily bored and want a splash of difference, from plain new colors, through pretty or cool patterns, to fully customizable designs. We’ve counted hundreds of designs on offer, so there must be something here for you and your iPhone 16.

1. Apple iPhone 16 Silicone Case with MagSafe – Popular, Apple-branded colorful case range

Pros

  • Made by Apple
  • Wide vibrant color range

Cons

  • Not as protective as others
  • Expensive
Price When Reviewed: $49
Best Prices Today: $37.99 at Amazon$37.99 at Best Buy$39.99 at Walmart Electronics
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 30g
  • Button covers: Silicone
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Covered
  • Colors: Star Fruit, Ultramarine, Lake Green, Fuchsia, Stone Gray, Plum, Black, Denim

Apple: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

Amazon: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

The smooth Apple Silicone case is a classic, popular protective iPhone covering—available in the widest range of colors with eight to choose from. There’s enough choice here to satisfy most people, but if you prefer to see the color of the iPhone itself, look to a clear case; see above.

Apple pretty much threw out all its lovely Silicone colors from the iPhone 15 (Guava, Orange Sorbet, Winter Blue, Black, Storm Blue, Clay. Light Pink, Cypress, Sunshine, Pink, Soft Mint, Light Blue) and dreamt up a whole new bunch, many of which are poppy and vibrant.

It is as protective as you need for everyday calamities except big falls—if you want ultra protection, look to our best protective cases reviewed further down. If you are prone to letting your phone slip out of your hand, look for cases made from TPU, Kevlar or Graphene.

It is made with a soft-touch, almost silky 55% recycled silicone material. Inside, the lining is soft microfiber to protect the iPhone itself from scratches.

Apple has added a silicone button to the Action button but left the new Camera Control button covered up with a conductive layer to communicate finger movements to the control—at the time of writing, only the OtterBox iPhone 16 case has anything similar with most other cases using a simple cutout for the Camera Control.

Apple has somehow engineered a little screen animation when you place the iPhone inside the Silicone Case, which is a nice—if otherwise not very useful—touch.

Aside from the colors and the attention to detail, people flock to this Apple case apart because it’s made by Apple and has the famous logo on the back. You can’t go wrong buying an Apple-made case, but you can find more options elsewhere.

2. Casetify iPhone 16 Case – Best custom iPhone 16 cases

Pros

  • Plenty of customization options
  • Protection levels

Cons

  • Expensive
Price When Reviewed: From $62
Best Prices Today: $48 at Amazon$62 at Casetify
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes (where stated)
  • Weight: 69g (Ultra Case)
  • Raised edge: 1.4 to 1.6mm
  • Camera edge: 2 to 3.8mm
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Cutout
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Multiple customization options

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

Amazon: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

While the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus colors have some panache, the 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max iPhones are a bit metal bachelor pad in our opinion. To add some fun you need a non-clear case, and if you want to impose your own personality then look for customization options.

The most customizable range of iPhone 16 cases we’ve seen are from Casetify, where you can mix and match colors, patterns, prints, artists, and personalization options, as well as several levels of protection.

Prices vary and rise depending on the protection levels, but for most you get a wide range of design options. The level of choice is almost overwhelming, and you’ll have fun choosing the case that looks just right for you.

You can add a name or short word, plus add hearts and stars, fonts, and text colors if you desire. Some cases feature a pull-out stand, which is otherwise hidden in the camera ring.

Casetify also offers a range of protection levels: Impact (8.2ft drop protection, 4x MIL-STD-810G or 6.6ft and 3x with a ring stand), Bounce (21.3ft drop protection, 6x MIL-STD-810G), Ultra Bounce (Bounce corners, 32.8 ft. drop protection, 10x MIL-STD-810G) and, for the 16 Pro and Pro Max, Ultra (Ultra Bounce corners, 32.8 ft. drop protection, 10x MIL-STD-810G, 6-layered rugged protection).

The raised bezel to protect the screen can be either 1.4mm or 1.6mm, and the protective camera ring from 2mm to 3.8mm. The Impact Ring case features the tallest camera-protecting lip at 3.6mm, the biggest we’ve seen in our tests.

You’ll find all the customization options direct from Casetify—see the links above.

3. Casely iPhone 16 Classic and Bold Cases – Best iPhone 16 case for colorful protection

Pros

  • Optional protection levels
  • Design options

Cons

  • Low camera edge
Price When Reviewed: From $25
Best Prices Today: $25 at Casely$39.95 at Amazon
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 34g (Bold Case)
  • Raised edge: 3mm (Bold), 1.3mm (Classic)
  • Camera edge: 1.33mm (Bold), 0.75mm (Classic)
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Over 60 designs available

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

Amazon: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

While not as customizable as the Casetify iPhone 16 cases, the range of Casely design options is almost overwhelming, including designs based on works by Impressionists Van Gogh and Monet. You could well end up buying more than one!

Aside from the 95+ designs, you can choose between the Classic and Bold case models for each type of iPhone 16. The Classic Collection is lighter and more flexible with a glossy finish, while the Bold Collection is more protective and comes with a matte finish.

The Bold models have ribbed sides, which adds real grip, making it less likely that you’ll drop your iPhone in the first place—but if you do there’s impressive 8-foot drop protection and a 3mm raised screen lip (only 1.3mm on the Classic), the highest we’ve tested. The camera edge could be a little higher, but we are big fans nonetheless.

Casely adds small shipping fees if bought direct—these are calculated at final checkout.

Uniquely Casely offers club membership where subscribers receive a new phone case every month, with exclusive members-only styles released each month. Users choose a style or Casely can send a surprise case.

4. Decoded Silicone Stacks Case – Best-looking iPhone 16 silicone cases

Pros

  • Wide vibrant color range
  • Two silicone styles

Cons

  • Low Screen and camera edge
Price When Reviewed: $57
Best Prices Today: $57 at Decoded
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 50g (16 Pro)
  • Button covers: Metal
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: 14 colors

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

The Apple Silicone cases include some vibrant colors, but for the widest range and some delightful flourishes we prefer the Decoded range of Silicone cases.

The standard Silicone Core range has the widest selection of colors, but the Silicone Stacks models include an attractive raised effect on the back that set them apart from other silicone cases.

There’s a range of vibrant and cool colors. The Silicone Stacks model is available in the exquisitely named Tangerine Orange, Bubblegum Pink, Mist Green, Phantom Black, Stone Gray and Super Sonic Blue. The standard Silicone Core is in Air Blue, Blue Print, Jade Green, Lilac Purple, Popcorn Yellow, Phantom Black, Sandstone Pink and Stone Gray.

On top of the color and back-effect choices the cases boast metal buttons and a lovely silky soft touch that will have you stroking the case like the seats of a new car.

Drop resistance up to 1.2 meters is claimed, although we’d have preferred a little more screen and camera edge height.

5. Zagg Milan iPhone 16 cases – Find your style and protection

Pros

  • Design options

Cons

  • Many color options U.S. only
Price When Reviewed: $49.99
Best Prices Today: $49.99 at Amazon$49.99 at Walmart Electronics$49.99 at Zagg
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Glitter, Floral, Geometric, Leopard, Iridescent

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

Amazon: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

There’s a huge choice of colors and patterns in the Milan Snap range of iPhone 16 cases from Zagg.

There are iridescent, glitter, floral, and geometric designs, each available in a range of eye-catching colors. The slim, lightweight profile ensures a comfortable fit in your pocket or hand, while up to 93% post-consumer recycled materials underscores a commitment to sustainability

Zagg’s London Snap range is covered with a fabric finish in a variety of playful designs, including a glow-in-the-dark Maze model.

Note that outside of the U.S. the color range is much smaller but still includes some lovely looking designs.

6. Mous Limitless 6.0 Case for iPhone 16 – Wide range of material designs

Pros

  • High protection level
  • Design options

Cons

  • Low screen and camera edge
Price When Reviewed: $74.99
Best Prices Today: $64.99 at Amazon$74.99 at Mous
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 42g (16 Pro)
  • Raised edge: 0.5mm
  • Camera edge: 0.5mm
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Walnut, Bamboo, Speckled Black, Black Leather, Aramid Fiber, Silver Pearl, Marine, Stone and Forest Green cases

Available for: All iPhone 16 models

The Limitless 6.0 is a range of iPhone 16 cases that mimics various materials, such as wood, pearl and leather on to its polycarbonate, TPU and TPE shell. We think this adds a certain gravity to the phone’s looks.

Protection level is high without making the case too bulky and the reinforced AiroShock impact-absorbing corner bumps are reasonably subtle. It has rippled grip ribs and side eyelets for wrist straps and phone slings.

There is also a range of Mous mounts for bikes, cars and motorbikes that work with the company’s Interlock Case.

The screen and camera edge height is a little lower than on most cases.

7. Wave Case for iPhone 16 – Best Sustainable iPhone 16 Eco Case

Pros

  • Biodegradable and plastic-free
  • Color options

Cons

  • Not all models are MagSafe compatible
Price When Reviewed: From $34
Best Prices Today: $34 at Wave
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes (where stated)
  • Weight: 40g (16 Pro)
  • Raised edge: 2mm
  • Camera edge: 2mm
  • Button covers: Recycled materials
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Black, Yellow, Turquoise, Pink, Khaki, Red, Blue, White

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

With the Wave range of biodegradable iPhone cases, you can protect your phone and the planet, reducing your plastic consumption. The plant-based phone cases are made from two commonly used biodegradable polymers. Known for its rigid and transparent properties PLA (Polylactic Acid) is derived from renewable resources such as wheat straw. PBAT (Polybutylene Adipate Terephthalate) is a biodegradable copolyester that offers flexibility and durability. Together they make an eco-friendly material that works well for phone protection.

You can also add a recycled glass screen protector.

Despite being plastic-free the smooth but grippy Wave cases have “been “military grade” (MIL-STD 810) drop protection, shock-absorbing corners and feature a generous protective 2mm lip around the screen and camera—one of the tallest we have seen.

Not all sustainable products are boring—the Wave cases come in a wide range of bright colors and printed designs. The case material adds a natural fleck to the design.

The standard and Etched case designs aren’t MagSafe compatible but will charge wirelessly. However, you can pay a little more for an integrated magnet that makes the case MagSafe compatible, which we would recommend.

8. OtterBox Lumen and Figura – Best psychedelic iPhone 16 cases

Pros

  • Unique edge-to-edge designs
Price When Reviewed: $49.95
Best Prices Today: $49.95 at Apple$49.95 at OtterBox
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 34g
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Black, Green, Blue, Pink

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

OtterBox is a well-known accessory maker, particularly in its protective phone cases. It has one of the widest ranges of iPhone 16 case models, and is favored by Apple as one of the few case manufacturers it allows to sell on its store.

Here we highlight the Lumen and Figura case designs.

The Lumen Case for iPhone 16 is sleek and minimalist with a clear, scratch-resistant case with fun pops of color, and textured side grips, as well as raised edges protect camera and screen. Like the Apple cases it keeps the Camera Control covered, with a conductive layer to communicate finger movements.

The super-slim Figura Case features psychedelic patterns that are hydro-dipped by hand. The graphics envelop the case from edge to edge. The material is flexible with a soft touch.

9. Beats iPhone 16 Case

Pros

  • Made by Apple (sort of)

Cons

  • Cool inside but dull outside
  • Expensive
Price When Reviewed: $49
Best Prices Today: $42.99 at Amazon$42.99 at Best Buy$49 at Apple
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 25g
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Covered
  • Colors: Night Black, Summit Stone, Flood Blue, Sunset Purple

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

Amazon: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

Remember when Beats was a hip brand? Now it’s owned by Apple and still makes some cool headphones, but its cases seem rather superfluous, offering little more than a glossy hardshell alternative to Apple’s much more fun but less protective Silicone iPhone 16 cases. It feels more like a colored version of the Apple Clear Case.

They do boast much more interesting bold interior accent colors, but these would have been better on the outside surely.

One benefit of being an Apple brand is that the Beats iPhone 16 cases also feature the sapphire crystal conductive layer that covers the Camera Control.

10. Atom Studios Soft Snap for iPhone 16 – Thinnest iPhone 16 case

Pros

  • Sustainably conscious materials

Cons

Best Prices Today: $39.99 at Atom Studios
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes

The Soft Snap is not a “case” in the same form as most of the protectors reviewed here. It’s more of a protective back plate.

It maintains the thinness of the iPhone 16 by adding only protection and color to the phone’s back and camera lenses. The case pops on and off with a snap, as the name suggests, and its lack of bulk means it will slip into and out of your pocket with ease.

While its lightweight minimalism will appeal to the slim and thin iPhone enthusiasts, it’s not for the cautious. There is no raised—or indeed any—front lip or side protection but the case is compatible with separate screen protectors.

Soft Snap is made from 100% recycled post-consumer plastic with a soft touch coating, with an interior that is lined with recycled plush microfiber.

Atom Studios also offers a more traditional but still eco-friendly iPhone 16 case: the dual-material Split Wood Fiber Case that is part aluminum and part eucalyptus oil-infused wood fiber. This case does offer solid 10-foot drop protection, with a 1mm raised edge—lower than on some cases but enough to save a screen from a small fall. The Camera Control is a cutout.

Atom

Best protective iPhone cases for iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max

A case isn’t there just to make your iPhone look pretty. The best cases offer reasonable protection while adding as little bulk as possible by using the latest, strongest materials.

Kevlar is the material used to make bulletproof vests—it’s also known as Aramid Fiber. Graphene is even stronger. Zagg claims the graphene used in its Denali Snap case is “harder than a diamond, yet more elastic than rubber, and up to 200x stronger than steel”. That suggests a fall onto the pavement—or indeed off a cliff—might not be fatal for your phone.

Some protective iPhone cases go full out and don’t care about their bulk as long as they protect your iPhone from the biggest disasters that can befall it. We’ve tested protective iPhone 16 cases from the thin to the very thick.

1. Zagg Denali Snap Case for iPhone 16 – Best Protective iPhone 16 Case

Pros

  • Super protection level
  • Kickstand option
  • Color options

Cons

  • Low camera edge
Price When Reviewed: $59.99
Best Prices Today: $49.99 at Amazon$59.99 at Walmart Electronics$59.99 at Zagg
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 52g (Denali Snap)
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Black, Navy, Thyme

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

Named after North America’s tallest mountain and boasting a claimed 16-foot (5m) drop protection (the highest we’ve seen), the dual-material Zagg Denali Snap is an ultra-protective iPhone 16 case that, surprisingly, is not as bulky as a boulder.

This is down to its Graphene-infused back plate. Graphene is the strongest material known to man—supposedly up to 200x stronger than steel. The case’s border features TPU. The camera lip isn’t as high as on some cases but it should protect the lenses when the phone is placed or dropped down flat.

Its rugged, textured finish adds a good grip, and when it’s not in your hand there’s an integrated metal kickstand that works in both landscape and portrait modes. It is constructed with up to 89% post-consumer recycled materials.

Zagg has a wide range of iPhone 16 cases, and its SoHo Snap, in a range of two-tone colors depending on which country you are shopping from. U.S. customers have the widest choice including a fetching Currant color, although only U.K. buyers can get their hands on the light blue version. It gains protection points as it also features a graphene-infused backplate with 10ft (3m) drop protection.

The Benks ArmorPro offers great protection via its “3X military standard aerospace-grade 600D DuPont Kevlar fiber”—the same material that’s used in body armor and bulletproof vests, so it should be up to the job of protecting your phone when you drop it onto the pavement. It’s a woven fiber, giving it a slightly textured grippy feel, to keep the iPhone from falling out of your hand in the first place. With some cases that sometimes leads to a struggle to pull it quickly from a pocket but we didn’t find this to be a problem with the Benks Kevlar cases.

The metal frame on the back gives raised protection around the camera lenses—one of the best we’ve seen. The buttons on the sides are nicely solid in the TPU frame that offers superior shock resistance.

It weighs 39g, which is light for a case offering such protection.

Benks also sells a lighter ArmorAir model that has exposed buttons and no TPU frame. Both have a cutout for the Camera Control. The ArmorPro can withstand a 6-foot drop; the ArmorAir just 4ft.

Both are MagSafe compatible, and priced the same—although there are slight price differences with the back pattern options.

While most cases protect from drops and falls, none is as grippy as the Smartish Gripzilla iPhone case that features special finger grooves along the textured sides that make it less likely for you to drop the phone from your hand in the first place. If you drop it, Smartish claims its air-pocket corners can withstand a drop from 6 feet, which should account for most non-giant-related accidents.

Slightly less grippy but still grippier than most cases, the Smartish Gripmunk case has the same textured sides for a firmer hold than you’ll get with a glossy case.

What is extra special about these Smartish cases is the ability to personalize the case back with a photo and text. This is easy to create on the Smartish website, uploading images and typing text until you have your perfect combination given the options available. For the Gripzilla case you are limited to the black case color, but you get further color options with the Gripmunk.

The company also sells an iPhone 16 case with a built-in wallet. The Smartish Wallet Slayer Vol. 2 can hold three credit or travel cards, and this part of the case can also work as a kickstand that lets you prop up your phone in landscape orientation. As with similar wallet cases, having the cards at the back of your phone case adds convenience but removes the wireless charging opportunity—for which you will need to remove your phone from the case.

This OtterBox Defender Pro case for the whole iPhone 16 family is constructed (by you) from three protective pieces. Don’t make the same mistake as me and try to force your iPhone directly into the case—first you need to deconstruct it and then build it around your phone. This might seem a pain, but you can see the level of protection you are building around your precious new phone.

It features shock-absorbing corners that don’t stick out too much like on some ultra-protective cases. The final layer provides grippy sides and back to help prevent phone drops in the first place.

One feature lacking from most cases is a protective port cover to stop fluff and other debris entering the USB-C opening. I’ve had to make a couple of trips to the Apple Store to remove dust and dirt that I couldn’t find myself, so appreciate this feature.

OtterBox also offers a two-part Defender Pro XT that is slimmer but features most of the non-XT features.

Both models can be bought with a free holster that clips to belts or bags and can double as a kickstand.

If you want your iPhone case to shout “Protection!”, Rokform’s aptly named Rugged Case looks the business. This is the phone case that Judge Dredd might carry in his holster.

Like its clear-ish Crystal Case reviewed in our clear case section higher up, the Rugged Case features N52 Neodymium magnets that mean you can very securely clamp your encased iPhone onto any metal surface, plus Rokform’s RokLock twist-lock mounting system for twist-lock bike mounts, motorcycle mounts and car and golf-cart mounts.

The impact-resistant polycarbonate protective shell features reinforced corners and extra camera protection that makes it a little chunkier than standard cases but reassuringly so, and not ridiculous. It is more rigid than the Zagg Denali Snap case, reviewed above, which also features a slightly more raised lip around the camera.

In its current form it is sadly not compatible with MagSafe wireless charging, but a newer and slimmer version is in the works, promises the company. If wireless charging is something you require or desire while your iPhone 16 is still in the case, we’d recommend waiting for the upgraded version, which we will report here.

The Camera Control is a cutout rather than a button, but the Action button is now covered. The buttons are plastic rather than the metal found on some other cases.

Rokform claims the case can withstand drops of up to 6 feet (1.8m) due to its construction from a combination of high-impact polycarbonate and rugged TPU for impact resistance and cushioning.

The Rugged Case comes in black only, while the Crystal Case will show off the iPhone’s true body color.

Unlike many of the cases reviewed here it boasts metal side buttons, although the Camera Control is a cutout.

As with the other Pitaka cases, it is constructed from robust aerospace-grade aramid fiber (aromatic polyamide) blended with shockproof TPU sides. This tough material resists scratches, abrasions and exposure to chemicals. An added benefit is that this weave gives the case textured patterns that stand out from the crowd. Inside it is lined with soft Nappa leather to provide cushioning for the back of the phone.

It is also slim and lightweight unlike chunkier protective cases and slides in and out of a pocket with ease. At present, the Military-Grade Protective Case is available for the iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max only.

For all iPhone 16 models, the Pitaka Tactile Woven Case is thinner and even lighter (19.4g) and available in a series of woven designs, such as Sunset, Moonrise, Over The Horizon, and Milky Way Galaxy. For the ultra-minimalist, the Pitaka Ultra Slim Case (18-35g) is available in Black/Grey, Forest Green, and Ocean Blue.

Best leather iPhone cases for iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max

Apple made a deliberate move away from leather with its accessories at the launch of the iPhone 15 and has stuck to its vegan ways with the iPhone 16. Apple’s alternative was a micro twill called FineWoven—however, customers were quick to complain that it easily picked up stains from just about anything it come into contact with, and the company has rightly abandoned it for its new iPhone.

If you want a leather alternative we recommend the vegan leather MOFT MOVAS case, reviewed below.

But if you are happier with the real animal skin thing, there are some great leather cases to choose from, as you’ll find by reading on.

Dutch designer Mujjo has been making some of our favorite leather Apple accessories for many years. It has four different cases available for the iPhone 16, three of them are crafted from premium leather and a new

Eager to win some green points, the company points out that sustainable “DriTan water-free leather tanning” is involved—this uses the moisture already present in the hides. The buttons, camera bump, microfiber lining, and polycarbonate inner shell are made from recycled plastic. All the cases feature machined-metal buttons, 1mm raised bezel and a metal rear camera bump for superior protection.

If you want a leather iPhone case with some extra benefits, the Mujjo Full Leather Wallet Case (for iPhone 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max) turns your iPhone into a physical as well as digital wallet. The leather card pocket can hold two or three bank, ID or travel cards. Note that the cards must be removed for wireless charging—even with cards removed, the magnetic connection is not as strong as with the cases that don’t include a wallet at the back, although it does still work with MagSafe chargers. To be fair, the same is true for all wallet-cases we tested. Available in Dark Tan, Black, or Monaco Blue.

The Mujjo Full Leather Case (all models except the 16 Plus) is a more classic leather case without the wallet at the back, with a machined-metal rear camera bump that protects lenses. It’s available in a range of colors depending on the iPhone model.

If you agree with Apple that leather is not for you, the Mujjo Maizcase is made with an Italian bio-leather, created with a blend of corn and other cereals and recycled polyester. It’s available in Steel Blue only.

The Mujjo iPhone 16 Pro Shield Case (for iPhone 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max) is designed to be super protective, as the name suggests, and is available for the two Pro models of the 16. Mujjo claims that drop protection is rated to 15 feet (5m), and it features an “ImpactCore internal bumper”. Take your choice of colors from Black or Steel Blue.

Best iPhone case with built-in keyboard

One of the joys of a smartphone is its lack of physical keyboard, which is why BlackBerry no longer makes phones. But … but… there are some benefits of ditching the virtual keyboard and freeing up valuable screen space after all.

1. Clicks case for iPhone 16 – Add a BlackBerry-like keyboard

Pros

  • Adds a physical 36-key keyboard
  • Access to iOS Shortcuts
  • Frees up screen space
  • Strong colors

Cons

  • Adds length to the phone
Price When Reviewed: From $139
Best Prices Today: $139 at Clicks
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 70g (Pro); 80g (Pro Max)
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Surf (blue), Onyx (black), Spice (ochre)
  • Available for: iPhone 16 all models

It seems an abomination to make the iPhone act and even look like a BlackBerry but there are people out there who want to have a physical keyboard attached to their iPhone.

Actually, it’s not as mad as it sounds. Not using the screen keyboard can give you back nearly half your usable screen, and it allows navigation within and between apps with fewer swipes and taps by turning each of its 37 keys into customizable action buttons for over 100 shortcuts, leveraging iOS’s native Shortcuts app and accessibility settings that are otherwise inaccessible to iPhone users.

Using the Clicks Keyboard app users can personalize their keyboard experience with features such as brightness levels, dim timeouts, battery optimization options, alt lock, and caps lock. You can even create an Android-like Back button. Additionally, the shortcuts can unlock advanced automations such as calling Uber, emailing meeting updates, and controlling smart home devices.

The Clicks version for iPhone 16 lacks some of the iPhone 15 Clicks crazy colors, but the new ochre color is still quite out there. The new iPhone 16 version features a refined keyboard with new contoured ergonomically designed keys that offer an elevated typing experience with a lighter touch, plus brushed metal side keys, a microfiber lining and a new enclosure. Clicks has spaced out the keys, which are 9% larger than on previous versions and you can really tell the difference.

The latest version now works with Apple’s MagSafe magnetic wireless charging, which was absent on the previous version.

Clicks for iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max will be available to order beginning October. Clicks for iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus models will be available in Dcember.

The Clicks for iPhone 16 Pro Case is 19.1cm long (compared to the phone’s 14.7cm length) and weighs 70g; for iPhone Pro Max, 20.7cm (16cm iPhone) and 80g. The case is now made from tougher TPU rather than silicone.

The $35 Roam M + Strap Shockproof Protective Case with Lanyard boasts 16-foot drop protection and a less chunky design than the Odyssey. It offers a more elegant lanyard with integrated hooks.

Looking quite unique, the $55 Pouch M Wallet Phone Case is a sleek 2-in-1 design that features a detachable wallet/purse with space for cards and folding cash. Coming with an adjustable leather strap, it can be worn over the shoulder or as a cross-body. Its zinc alloy clasp is well placed so that it doesn’t obstruct the camera lenses.

Mageasy also offers a robust $39 MagStand 360 M with Rotating Ring Holder Protective Case, which doesn’t boast the lanyard option but is a solid and well-built clear iPhone 16 case with the same 360-degree ring stand as the Odyssey Ultra but with a lesser (but still impressive) 16-foot drop protection.

2. BodyGuardz Paradigm Pro case for iPhone 16 Pro – with removable wrist strap for iPhone 16

Pros

  • Removable wrist strap
  • Heat vents
Price When Reviewed: $54.95
Best Prices Today: $49.95 at Amazon$54.95 at Bodyguardz
  • MagSafe compatible: Yes
  • Weight: 59g (16 Pro) with wrist strap
  • Button covers: Plastic
  • Action button: Covered
  • Camera Control: Cutout
  • Colors: Black, Blue, Green, Purple, Leopard, Clear

Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max

Keeping your iPhone out of your tight pocket or bag could have the added benefit of keeping it cool—unless you are in a very hot environment—with a a healthier battery as a result. The BodyGuardz Paradigm Pro case, available for iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max, makes heat dissipation one of its core strengths with both a wrist strap and air vents along both sides. The company names this system of vents “EnduraCore technology”, and it’s a clever move to both improve the iPhone’s temperature and distinguish it from other cases.

For non-Pro owners, there’s the BodyGuardz Ace Pro, which also comes with a detachable wrist strap but not the air vents. You do get a Black Leopard spot pattern, though.

Both cases promise 18-foot drop protection and shock-absorbing corners. The wrist strap might deter pickpockets and other phone thieves, preventing speedy snatches out of your grasp.

Best bags and slings for iPhone 16

If you don’t want to have your iPhone sticking out of your back pocket for all the world to see and seize, or jammed into a tight front pocket, consider a small bag or sling to keep your new iPhone protected and held away from your person.

1. WaterField Shinjuku Sling

Pros

  • Stylish sling
  • Tech organizer
Price When Reviewed: $129
Best Prices Today: $129 at WaterField Designs
  • Size: 8 x 2.5 x 5 inches (20.3 x 6.4 x 12.7cm
  • Weight: 320g (Waxed), 150g (Canvas)
  • Colors: Waxed Canvas: Navy or Brown; Canvas Storm Gray, Black or Olive Green

Available for: All iPhone models

WaterField Designs makes great bags and its mini crossbody Shinjuku Sling is aimed at owners of the iPhone 16. A sling keeps your iPhone and other essentials close at hand and handsfree but not ruining the cut of your clothes. You don’t always need a full backpack, and a small sling like this may be all you need on a day out or commute.

There’s just one size that will fit either any model of iPhone. There are two materials to choose from: a heavy-duty 15oz Waxed Canvas with a naturally rugged, distressed look, or lightweight waterproof X-Pac Canvas, in various colors.

At the front a zippered pocket can store frequently needed items like a travel card or reading glasses. Inside, with a light diamond-patterned lining, there’s a side pocket that is foam-padded to cradle the iPhone, and two stretch pockets for your AirPods or whatever small items you don’t want to keep in your pockets. There’s even space in the central compartment for a slim 16oz water bottle, as well as keys. At the back you’ll find (but thieves won’t see) a zippered pocket that’s perfect for cash or a passport.

The strap features a quick-release buckle that lets attach it to a chair or other furniture to protect it from thieves when you’re seated.

How we tested iPhone 16 cases

We tested the reviewed cases above using an iPhone 16 Pro. We tested for fit, look and feel, build quality, and magnetic wireless charging. We did not test the claims for Military Grade Protection by throwing the encased phone from speeding trains or hot air balloons or throwing it to the pavement. We have to trust the manufacturer’s claims on this but we did examine the raised screen and camera edges for robustness.
